definition[0]: not supporting any of the people or groups involved in an argument or disagreement
example[0]: I always tried to remain neutral when they started arguing.
example[1]: Clive decided to adopt a neutral position.
example[2]: The British government acted as a neutral observer during the talks.
definition[1]: a country that is neutral does not support any of the countries involved in a war
note[0]: neutral territory/waters (=land or sea that is not controlled by any of the countries involved in a war)
example[3]: During World War II, Sweden was neutral.
definition[2]: language, words etc that are neutral are deliberately chosen to avoid expressing any strong opinion or feeling
example[4]: the neutral language of an official news report
definition[3]: if someone says something in a neutral voice, or if they have a neutral expression on their face, they do not show how they are feeling
example[5]: Bragg said in a neutral voice, ‘The investigation has been closed down.’
definition[4]: a neutral colour is a colour such as grey, light brown, or cream
example[6]: Neutral tones give the room a feeling of space.
definition[5]: a neutral wire, for example in a plug, has no electrical charge1(7)
definition[6]: a neutral substance is neither acid nor alkaline
example[7]: The plant prefers a neutral or slightly acidic soil.
definition[7]: the position of the gears of a car or machine when no power is being sent from the engine to the wheels or other moving parts
example[9]: When you start the engine, make sure the car’s in neutral.
definition[8]: a country, person, or group that is not involved in an argument or disagreement
